alert.note: Alert for Robeson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Robeson, northwestern Columbus, Dillon, northwestern Horry, northeastern Marion and Marlboro Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 244 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Raemon, or 9 miles southeast of Laurinburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Bennettsville, Marion, Dillon, Mullins, Red Springs, Pembroke, Fairmont, Maxton, Mccoll, St. Pauls, Latta, Rowland, Fair Bluff, Lake View, Clio, Sellers, Boardman, Rex and Hamer. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 181 and 198. Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 1 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
